bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis J. Iglesias, April 30, 1941

div1.p: Hench thanks Iglesias for his hospitality during his visit to the Military Hospital. He informs him that he will receive a copy of the "Proceedings of the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings" on a regular basis.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis J. Iglesias, April 30, 1941
div1.opener:
Same letter to:
Dr. Jose Randin, Ciudad Militar, Habana, Cuba
Dr. Luis M. Angulo, Ayundantia General, Ciudad Militar, Habana, Cuba
April 30, 1941
Dr. Luis J. Iglesias
Genios #161
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Iglesias:
div1.p:
I have just returned from my vacation in
Florida, and look back with much pleasure on my visit to
the Military Hospital. I appreciated greatly the many
courtesies extended to me, and hope that I may have the
privilege of showing you around the Mayo Clinic some time.

I have asked the editor of the Proceedings
of the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings to send you, with our
compliments, these Proceedings regularly.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
